definition: to represent or encode information as a sequence of numerical characters from 0 to 9; to form a string consisting exclusively of decimal digits for computational or representational purposes
opposite_reasoning: NonNumericString provides the strongest logical opposition as the direct complement - it forms a clean binary partition of all possible strings. For Fisher-LDA, this creates a maximally separable axis: strings composed exclusively of decimal digits versus strings containing any non-digit characters. While it may not exist in current ontologies, it represents the most semantically coherent opposite for steering purposes. The complementary relationship (A ∪ ¬A covers all cases) makes it ideal for concept axis formation. AlphabeticString is a close second but is more specific (excludes mixed alphanumeric and symbolic strings).
